categoryRecipes.title: Seasonal Garden Pasta
categoryRecipes.description: A delicious pasta dish packed full with vegetables and herbs you can grow straight from your garden.
categoryRecipes.ingredients:
- 100g pasta
- 1 courgette
- 1 minced garlic clove
- 200g sweetcorn
- 1 sweet bell pepper
- 1 yellow onion
- 12 cherry tomatoes
- 50ml white wine
- 1 tbsp tomato puree
- 50g cheddar cheese
- salt & pepper
- fresh parsley
- olive oil
categoryRecipes.instructions:
Roughly chop the courgette, peppers and onion, and fry for 10 minutes in a tablespoon of olive oil. Season generously with salt & pepper. While your vegetables are cooking, prepare your pasta in salted water and cook following packet instructions.
Add the minced garlic clove and fry for 30 seconds before adding the cherry tomatoes. Allow the tomatoes to soften and release their juices before adding the white wine. Cook on a high temperature for 2-3 minutes to allow the alcohol to burn off.
Add the tablespoon of tomato pure and stir well to create a sauce. If the sauce is too thick, add 1-2 ladles of the starchy pasta water.
Once cooked, use a slotted ladle and add the pasta straight to the vegetable sauce. Then add the tinned sweetcorn and cook for a further 2-3 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir through the cheddar cheese before adding the chopped parsley for serving.

categoryRecipes.title: Avocado & Feta Smash with Eggs
categoryRecipes.description: A tasty cafe special that's quick and easy, and great with any type of egg you like. Perfect for brunch, and afternoon lunch or a light evening meal.
categoryRecipes.ingredients:
- 1 avocado
- 100g feta cheese
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 tsp chilli flakes
- 1 lemon (rind & juice)
- 4 slices sourdough
- salt & pepper
- Hendersons Relish
categoryRecipes.instructions:
Roughly mix together the avocado with the feta cheese using the back of a fork. Add the chilli flakes, lemon juice and rind, and season with pepper. Set aside while you cook your eggs.
Either poach fry or scramble your eggs. What ever you fancy, this recipe works well any way you like to cook your eggs.
Toast your sourdough. Plate up with by spreading your avocado and feta mix across your sourdough. Top each slice with an egg and finish with salt & pepper, and a dash of Henderson's Relish.
